definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
season/the last month of a season/fourth or youngest amongst brothers/classifier for seasonal crop yields
Green Dam Youth Escort, Internet content-control software (abbreviated to 綠壩|绿坝[Lu:4 ba4])
pinyin: Lu:4 ba4 · hua1 ji4 hu4 hang2

sentences.english: As far as I know. It has no definite season—no birthday, so to speak.
sentences.chinese: 據我所知，這種花沒有特定的花季也就是沒有生日。

sentences.english: Being affected by the Super Girl Contest, many young girls dream of becoming famous.
sentences.chinese: 受超女的影響，很多花季少女都開始夢想成名。

sentences.english: Buckle ring a bell when the young sixteen year-old young, I ushered in my high school.
sentences.chinese: 當青春的鐘扣響十六歲的花季，我迎來了我的高中。

sentences.english: The remaining of thousand years flutters those blooming flower seasons, floating to fall those raining seasons.
sentences.chinese: 千年的餘輝搖曳那些花季，飄落那些雨季。

sentences.english: My colored season is spreads out all over in here.
sentences.chinese: 我的花季是在這裏鋪展開的。

sentences.english: The passage of time, follow the 15-year-old season.
sentences.chinese: 時光流逝，接踵而來的是十五歲的花季。

definition: a girl's teenage years (idiom); maidenhood/a budding beauty
first awakening of love (usually of a girl) (idiom)
(of a plant) to be in bud
(of a girl) in the prime of youth
